cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi SSW of Tiburon, Haiti and 140 mi E of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to turn northwest across central/western Cuba Monday, then north toward the Florida Peninsula and recurving NE up the U.S. Southeast coast before moving offshore of the Mid-Atlantic late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (near the Tampa Bay region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cayman Brac & Little Cayman, portions of western Cuba, and the Florida Keys from Craig Key to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Southern Haiti, portions of eastern & central Cuba, Jamaica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Florida west coast, U.S. Southeast coastline from Florida to the Carolinas, then offshore Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (5%) of tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday; otherwise breezy conditions with gusts below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Chesapeake Bay with current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€“2 inches of rain possible late Thursday into Friday as the remnants of Elsa pass nearby.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibility and localized ponding on terminal surfaces; possible minor schedule disruption.
